channel.title: Auth0 Blog
channel.description: Company Updates, Technology Articles from Auth0

item.title: Why MCP’s Move Away from Server-Sent Events Simplifies Security
item.author: william.johnson@auth0.com
item.dc:creator: Will Johnson
item.description: Discover why the Model Context Protocol (MCP) deprecated Server-Sent Events (SSE) for Streamable HTTP and how this shift enables stronger authentication, standard CORS policies, and secure session management.

item.title: Build an AI Assistant with LangGraph, Next.js, and Auth0 Connected Accounts
item.author: deepu.sasidharan@okta.com
item.dc:creator: Deepu K Sasidharan
item.description: Learn how to build a tool-calling AI agent using LangGraph, Next.js, and Auth0. Integrate GitHub and Slack tools using Connected Accounts for Token Vault.

item.title: Bulletproof Hosting Defense: Mitigating the Proxy Threat with Threat Intelligence
item.description: Learn how to mitigate the risks of Bulletproof Hosting providers using Auth0 Actions and threat intelligence signals to secure your identity infrastructure.

item.title: Auth0 My Account API: Let Users Manage Their Own Account
item.author: andrea.chiarelli@auth0.com
item.dc:creator: Andrea Chiarelli
item.description: Learn how the Auth0 My Account API securely enables client-side, self-service user management, eliminating the need for server-side proxies for features like passkey enrollment and account linking.

item.title: Continuous Authorization Testing: FGA, GitHub Actions, and CI/CD
item.author: carla.urrea@okta.com
item.dc:creator: Carla Urrea Stabile
item.description: Learn how to achieve continuous confidence in your authorization logic. This article will guide you on defining OpenFGA test files and integrating them into a robust CI/CD pipeline using GitHub Actions.

item.title: FAPI for Developers: Here Is Your Guide
item.author: andrea.chiarelli@auth0.com
item.dc:creator: Andrea Chiarelli
item.description: A new ebook is available to explain why FAPI is essential for regulated industries, and how to move beyond OAuth bearer tokens for top identity security.

item.title: An Accessible Guide to WCAG 3.3.9: Going for Gold
item.author: ramona.schwering@okta.com
item.dc:creator: Ramona Schwering
item.description: WCAG 3.3.8 sets minimum standards for accessible authentication. 3.3.9 enhances these by removing exceptions and automating cognitive tests for users.

item.title: Express Configuration is now GA for Auth0 SaaS apps in the Okta Integration Network
item.description: Express Configuration with Okta is now Generally Available for Auth0 applications in the Okta Integration Network

item.title: Simplify Your Stack (and Save!): A Guide to Linking Your Auth0 Tenants
item.dc:creator: Alisha Tingle
item.description: Learn how to use the Auth0 Teams feature to link your Auth0 tenants for immediate billing consolidation and simplified feature management.

item.title: Using an API Gateway with Fine-Grained Authorization
item.author: carla.urrea@okta.com
item.dc:creator: Carla Urrea Stabile
item.description: In this blog post you’ll learn about different API Gateways: Zuplo, Kong, and Apache APISIX, and how each one could work best for a service that uses Fine-Grained Authorization.
